result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E Donnell Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Habitual Criminality], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
++ Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.     Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges - civil judgment entered.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: Civil judgment entered for all court obligations.
PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED. TIME IS SERVED.

Defendant, Charles E Donnell, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Amy Schneider.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:  Sentence:
Ct 2:  1 year in the KCJ with 91 days credit, forthwith, and def. taken into custody.
Cts 1 & 3:  Sentence withheld, def. placed on 3 years probation w/conditions, consecutive to Ct 2. 
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Court costs ordered.  Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on October 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State and KPD Det. Eric Traxler.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Day 3.  Jurors deliberate at 8:20am.  Verdicts reached at 10:40am.  Jury finds deft guilty of lesser included cts 1, 2 & guilty of ct 3.  Court polls juror's.  Juror's are excused at 11:01am.  Court finds deft guilty of lesser included cts 1 & 2 and guilty of ct 3.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 9/1/16 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Items D 3-5 are large posterboards stored separately.  ebs

Alternate juror is #8098, excused at 5:03pm.  Jurors to begin to deliberate on 6/30/16 at 8am.  Juror's excused at 5:04pm.

Chief John Morrissey present.  Atty Celebre's motion for discovery.  Court grants motion for en camera inspection.  Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $5,000 cash bond.
